page.title: 16 MEDIEVAL SITE LOWER PENARTH
page.content: The village is situated near Cosmeston country park.It was occupied{800 years ago.The village is being excavated by archaeologists from{Glamorgan Gwent {Archaeological}Trust.They started in 1982,when looking for{Cosmeston Castle They are using unemployed.The Trust have found remains of an{old farmhouse {bakehouse and}dovecote.A path between the houses was for carts and animals. It is thought the village was deserted either because of the{Black Death}or famine.There is an exhibition caravan with{12th century coins, pottery and drawings of medieval life.A{medieval {fair}will be held on the 26th Aug.1985 where you can sit in stocks,see a bear dancing,eat venison,drink ale and"Hunt the Witch".Nearby in an old cottage is a{craft shop}where you can buy hand woven wall-hangings,knitted woollen garments and commissioned pottery.
